org.jpws.pwslib.persist
Class DefaultUrlAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.persist.DefaultUrlAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ApplicationAdapter
public class DefaultUrlAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ApplicationAdapter

Implements a straight forward ApplicationAdapter for addressing URL protocol files, based on the java.net package.

Since:
0-3-0

list

public java.lang.String[] list(java.lang.String trunk,
                               java.lang.String trail,
                               boolean recurse)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: ApplicationAdapter
Returns a list of full file paths from the directory system of this IO-context which all start with the text of trunk. trail is an optional additional selection criterion determining the file path ending. Directories are not included in the result list.

Specified by:
list in interface ApplicationAdapter
Parameters:
trunk - starting text of resulting file paths; if the path name of a directory is entered, it must end with a separator sign. (The behaviour if parameter is empty is context specific hence undefined)
trail - if not null ending text of resulting file paths
recurse - if true files of subdirectories are included
Returns:
String array of file paths in IO-context or null indicating this function is not supported
Throws:
java.io.IOException

separator

public java.lang.String separator()
Description copied from interface: ApplicationAdapter
The separating character of path-name elements in the convention of this IO-context.

Specified by:
separator in interface ApplicationAdapter

getUrl

public java.net.URL getUrl(java.lang.String filepath)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: ApplicationAdapter
Returns an URL descriptor specifying a file in this application context identified by the parameter path string. It is assumed the naming is canonised. Adapters which cannot describe their files as URL may return null.

Specified by:
getUrl in interface ApplicationAdapter
Returns:
URL file descriptor or null
Throws:
java.io.IOException

Specified by:

Returns:
